title: Optima - similar styles
content:
hey everybody,

i'm trying to spec another typeface that's similar to Adobe's Optima.... any help/suggestions would be great...

for reference: [http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=optima&producttype=TYP%2...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042719/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=optima&producttype=TYP%2CIMG%2CILL&pricemodel=RM%2CRF "http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=optima&producttype=TYP%2CIMG%2CILL&pricemodel=RM%2CRF")

thx,  
jsds
author: jsds

comments.content:

But the best Optima look-a-like is the one you can't have:

[http://typecuts.com/fonts.php?kid=8](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042719/http:/typecuts.com/fonts.php?kid=8 "http://typecuts.com/fonts.php?kid=8")

Is that not gorgeous!!!

Mikey :-)

<cite>Is that not gorgeous!!!</cite>

That is one of the most beautiful fonts I have ever laid eyes on.  
I love the monocase version. The 'it' and 'gi' ligatures are lovely too. I could have done without knowing about that one. Now I have to go through coveting recovery.
URW Imperial Does the graphic on that page reflect the font? There are all kinds of odd serifs that I kind of like, but Imperial doesn't seem to have them.

It looks like someone used DTC Imperial (a completely different font) to create the graphic instead of URW Imperial.

- Lex

[Indeed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042719/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/imperial-dtc/).

I’d never noticed that. Looking at the graphic, I was very surprised.

- Akira
